result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher Russell Koch was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All amounts due are to be paid at a rate of $100 per month commencing July 15, 2022 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full. There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Court authorizes transfer to Winnebago County or any other jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher Russell Koch in court. Attorney Joseph Reback in court for Christopher Russell Koch. Agreement reached for plea with partial joint sentencing recommendation. Def pleads guilty to count #1; def is convicted. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. Argument by counsel on sentence. Statements by defendant. Defendant sentenced.
